subject: Programming
title: The Boy Scout Rule
description: A quick win: understand The Boy Scout Rule.

hook.text: Leave the campground cleaner than you found it. Robert C. Martin applied this to code.

buildup.text: Every time you touch a file, improve one small thing â€” rename a variable, extract a method.

discovery.text: Over weeks, thousands of tiny improvements compound into a dramatically cleaner codebase.

twist.text: No one has time for big cleanups. But everyone has time to fix one thing while they're already there.

climax.text: Quality isn't a project. It's a habit applied one commit at a time.

punchline.text: Leave every file a little better than you found it.

quiz.question: What does the Boy Scout Rule mean for code?
options: Leave files cleaner than you found them
